trans-unit.source: Step 5: Publish the Machine Learning web service | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Publish the Machine Learning web service | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Step 5 of the Develop a predictive solution walkthrough: Publish a scoring experiment in Machine Learning Studio as a web service.
trans-unit.target: Step 5 of the Develop a predictive solution walkthrough: Publish a scoring experiment in Machine Learning Studio as a web service.

trans-unit.source: Walkthrough Step 5: Publish the Azure Machine Learning web service
trans-unit.target: Walkthrough Step 5: Publish the Azure Machine Learning web service

trans-unit.source: This is the fifth step of the walkthrough, <link><linkText>Developing a Predictive Solution with Azure ML</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: This is the fifth step of the walkthrough, <link><linkText>Developing a Predictive Solution with Azure ML</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Create a Machine Learning workspace</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Create a Machine Learning workspace</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Upload existing data</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Upload existing data</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Create a new experiment</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Create a new experiment</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Train and evaluate the models</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Train and evaluate the models</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Publish the web service
trans-unit.target: Publish the web service

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Access the web service</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Access the web service</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: To make this predictive model useful to others, we'll publish it as a web service on Azure.
trans-unit.target: To make this predictive model useful to others, we'll publish it as a web service on Azure.

trans-unit.source: Up to this point we've been experimenting with training our model.
trans-unit.target: Up to this point we've been experimenting with training our model.

trans-unit.source: But the published service is no longer going to do training - it will be scoring the user's input.
trans-unit.target: But the published service is no longer going to do training - it will be scoring the user's input.

trans-unit.source: So we're going to do some preparation and then publish this experiment as a working web service that users can access.
trans-unit.target: So we're going to do some preparation and then publish this experiment as a working web service that users can access.

trans-unit.source: A user will be able to send a set of credit application data to the service, and the service will return the prediction of credit risk.
trans-unit.target: A user will be able to send a set of credit application data to the service, and the service will return the prediction of credit risk.

trans-unit.source: To do this, we need to:
trans-unit.target: To do this, we need to:

trans-unit.source: Convert the training experiment we've created into a scoring experiment
trans-unit.target: Convert the training experiment we've created into a scoring experiment

trans-unit.source: Publish the scoring experiment as a web service
trans-unit.target: Publish the scoring experiment as a web service

trans-unit.source: But first, we need to trim this experiment down a little.
trans-unit.target: But first, we need to trim this experiment down a little.

trans-unit.source: We currently have two different models in the experiment, but we now need to select one model to publish.
trans-unit.target: We currently have two different models in the experiment, but we now need to select one model to publish.

trans-unit.source: Let's say we've decided that the boosted tree model was the better model to use.
trans-unit.target: Let's say we've decided that the boosted tree model was the better model to use.

trans-unit.source: So the first thing to do is remove the <link><linkText>Two-Class Support Vector Machine[two-class-support-vector-machine]</linkText><title></title></link> module and the modules that were used for training it.
trans-unit.target: So the first thing to do is remove the <link><linkText>Two-Class Support Vector Machine[two-class-support-vector-machine]</linkText><title></title></link> module and the modules that were used for training it.

trans-unit.source: You may want to make a copy of the experiment first by clicking Save As at the bottom of the experiment canvas.
trans-unit.target: You may want to make a copy of the experiment first by clicking Save As at the bottom of the experiment canvas.

trans-unit.source: We need to delete the following modules:
trans-unit.target: We need to delete the following modules:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Two-Class Support Vector Machine[two-class-support-vector-machine]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Two-Class Support Vector Machine[two-class-support-vector-machine]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Train Model[train-model]</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Score Model[score-model]</linkText><title></title></link> modules that were connected to it
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Train Model[train-model]</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Score Model[score-model]</linkText><title></title></link> modules that were connected to it

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Normalize Data[normalize-data]</linkText><title></title></link> (both of them)
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Normalize Data[normalize-data]</linkText><title></title></link> (both of them)

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Evaluate Model[evaluate-model]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Evaluate Model[evaluate-model]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Now we're ready to publish this model.
trans-unit.target: Now we're ready to publish this model.

trans-unit.source: Convert the training experiment to a scoring experiment
trans-unit.target: Convert the training experiment to a scoring experiment

trans-unit.source: Converting to a scoring experiment involves three steps:
trans-unit.target: Converting to a scoring experiment involves three steps:

trans-unit.source: Save the model we've trained and replace our training modules with it
trans-unit.target: Save the model we've trained and replace our training modules with it

trans-unit.source: Trim the experiment to remove modules that were only needed for training
trans-unit.target: Trim the experiment to remove modules that were only needed for training

trans-unit.source: Define where the web service input and output nodes should be
trans-unit.target: Define where the web service input and output nodes should be

trans-unit.source: Fortunately, all three steps can be accomplished by just clicking Create Scoring Experiment at the bottom of the experiment canvas.
trans-unit.target: Fortunately, all three steps can be accomplished by just clicking Create Scoring Experiment at the bottom of the experiment canvas.

trans-unit.source: When you click Create Scoring Experiment, several things happen:
trans-unit.target: When you click Create Scoring Experiment, several things happen:

trans-unit.source: The model we trained is saved as a Trained Model module in the module palette to the left of the experiment canvas (you can find it in the palette under Trained Models).
trans-unit.target: The model we trained is saved as a Trained Model module in the module palette to the left of the experiment canvas (you can find it in the palette under Trained Models).

trans-unit.source: Modules that were used for training are removed.
trans-unit.target: Modules that were used for training are removed.

trans-unit.source: Specifically:
trans-unit.target: Specifically:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree[two-class-boosted-decision-tree]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Two-Class Boosted Decision Tree[two-class-boosted-decision-tree]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Train Model[train-model]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Train Model[train-model]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Split[split]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Split[split]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: the second <link><linkText>Execute R Script[execute-r-script]</linkText><title></title></link> module that was used for test data
trans-unit.target: the second <link><linkText>Execute R Script[execute-r-script]</linkText><title></title></link> module that was used for test data

trans-unit.source: The saved trained model is added to the experiment.
trans-unit.target: The saved trained model is added to the experiment.

trans-unit.source: Web service input and Web service output modules are added.
trans-unit.target: Web service input and Web service output modules are added.

trans-unit.source: The experiment has been saved in two parts: the original training experiment, and the new scoring experiment.
trans-unit.target: The experiment has been saved in two parts: the original training experiment, and the new scoring experiment.

trans-unit.source: You can access either one using the tabs at the top of the experiment canvas.
trans-unit.target: You can access either one using the tabs at the top of the experiment canvas.

trans-unit.source: We need to take an additional step with our experiment.
trans-unit.target: We need to take an additional step with our experiment.

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio removed one <link><linkText>Execute R Script[execute-r-script]</linkText><title></title></link> module when it removed the <link><linkText>Split[split]</linkText><title></title></link> module, but it left the other <link><linkText>Execute R Script[execute-r-script]</linkText><title></title></link> module.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio removed one <link><linkText>Execute R Script[execute-r-script]</linkText><title></title></link> module when it removed the <link><linkText>Split[split]</linkText><title></title></link> module, but it left the other <link><linkText>Execute R Script[execute-r-script]</linkText><title></title></link> module.

trans-unit.source: Since that module was only used for training and testing (it provided a weighting function on the sample data), we can now remove it and connect <link><linkText>Metadata Editor[metadata-editor]</linkText><title></title></link> to <link><linkText>Score Model[score-model]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Since that module was only used for training and testing (it provided a weighting function on the sample data), we can now remove it and connect <link><linkText>Metadata Editor[metadata-editor]</linkText><title></title></link> to <link><linkText>Score Model[score-model]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Our experiment should now look like this:
trans-unit.target: Our experiment should now look like this:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scoring the trained model</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scoring the trained model</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You may be wondering why we left the UCI German Credit Card Data dataset in the scoring experiment.
trans-unit.target: You may be wondering why we left the UCI German Credit Card Data dataset in the scoring experiment.

trans-unit.source: The service is going to use the user's data, not the original dataset, so why leave them connected?
trans-unit.target: The service is going to use the user's data, not the original dataset, so why leave them connected?

trans-unit.source: It's true that the service doesn't need the original credit card data.
trans-unit.target: It's true that the service doesn't need the original credit card data.

trans-unit.source: But it does need the schema for that data, which includes information such as how many columns there are and which columns are numeric.
trans-unit.target: But it does need the schema for that data, which includes information such as how many columns there are and which columns are numeric.

trans-unit.source: This schema information is necessary in order to interpret the user's data.
trans-unit.target: This schema information is necessary in order to interpret the user's data.

trans-unit.source: We leave these components connected so that the scoring module will have the dataset schema when the service is running.
trans-unit.target: We leave these components connected so that the scoring module will have the dataset schema when the service is running.

trans-unit.source: The data isn't used, just the schema.
trans-unit.target: The data isn't used, just the schema.

trans-unit.source: Run the experiment one last time (click RUN).
trans-unit.target: Run the experiment one last time (click RUN).

trans-unit.source: If you want to verify that the model is still working, click the output of the Score Model[score-model] module and select View Results.
trans-unit.target: If you want to verify that the model is still working, click the output of the Score Model[score-model] module and select View Results.

trans-unit.source: You'll see that the original data is displayed, along with the credit risk value ("Scored Labels") and the scoring probability value ("Scored Probabilities").
trans-unit.target: You'll see that the original data is displayed, along with the credit risk value ("Scored Labels") and the scoring probability value ("Scored Probabilities").

trans-unit.source: Publish the web service
trans-unit.target: Publish the web service

trans-unit.source: To publish a web service derived from our experiment, click PUBLISH WEB SERVICE below the canvas.
trans-unit.target: To publish a web service derived from our experiment, click PUBLISH WEB SERVICE below the canvas.

trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Studio publishes the experiment as a web service and takes you to the service dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Studio publishes the experiment as a web service and takes you to the service dashboard.

trans-unit.source: You can update the web service after you've published it.
trans-unit.target: You can update the web service after you've published it.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to change your model, just edit the training experiment, tweak the model parameters, and click PUBLISH WEB SERVVICE.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to change your model, just edit the training experiment, tweak the model parameters, and click PUBLISH WEB SERVVICE.

trans-unit.source: When you publish the experiment again, it will replace the web service, now using your updated model.
trans-unit.target: When you publish the experiment again, it will replace the web service, now using your updated model.

trans-unit.source: You can configure the service by clicking the CONFIGURATION tab.
trans-unit.target: You can configure the service by clicking the CONFIGURATION tab.

trans-unit.source: Here you can modify the service name (it's given the experiment name by default) and give it a description.
trans-unit.target: Here you can modify the service name (it's given the experiment name by default) and give it a description.

trans-unit.source: You can also give more friendly labels for the input and output columns.
trans-unit.target: You can also give more friendly labels for the input and output columns.

trans-unit.source: Test the web service
trans-unit.target: Test the web service

trans-unit.source: On the DASHBOARD page, click the Test link under Default Endpoint.
trans-unit.target: On the DASHBOARD page, click the Test link under Default Endpoint.

trans-unit.source: A dialog will pop up and ask you for the input data for the service.
trans-unit.target: A dialog will pop up and ask you for the input data for the service.

trans-unit.source: These are the same columns that appeared in the original German credit risk dataset.
trans-unit.target: These are the same columns that appeared in the original German credit risk dataset.

trans-unit.source: Enter a set of data and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Enter a set of data and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: The results generated by the web service are displayed at the bottom of the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: The results generated by the web service are displayed at the bottom of the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: The way we have the service configured, the results you see are generated by the scoring module.
trans-unit.target: The way we have the service configured, the results you see are generated by the scoring module.

trans-unit.source: **Next: <link><linkText>Access the web service</linkText><title></title></link>**
trans-unit.target: **Next: <link><linkText>Access the web service</linkText><title></title></link>**

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
